Author: Allison
Title: Dependencies on issues
EnhancedContent:
Dependencies on issues are now generally available! You can now specify which issues are **blocked by** or **blocking** others, making it easy for teams to define work that must be completed before other work can begin. This has been one of our most requested features.

## ‚ûï Getting started

To get started, open the **Relationships** section in the issues sidebar and select **Mark as blocked by** or **Mark as blocking**. You can link up to 50 issues for each relationship type.

[https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/mark_blocked_by.mp4#t=0.001](https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/mark_blocked_by.mp4#t=0.001)

## üîç Search and view blocked issues

You can view blocked issues in your projects and in the repository **Issues** tab. You can also get started by using the following filters to search for them:

- `is:blocked`
‚Äî returns all blocked issues
- `is:blocking`
‚Äî returns all issues that are blocking others
- `blocked-by:`
‚Äî returns issues blocked by a specific issue
- `blocking:`
‚Äî returns issues blocking a specific issue

[https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/search_blocked_by.mp4#t=0.001](https://github.blog/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/search_blocked_by.mp4#t=0.001)

## ‚öôÔ∏è API and webhooks

Issue dependencies are fully supported in the API and webhooks. Learn more in our documentation:

- [REST API](https://docs.github.com/rest/issues/issue-dependencies?versionId=free-pro-team@latest&page=mutations&apiVersion=2022-11-28)
- [GraphQL API](https://docs.github.com/graphql/reference/mutations#addblockedby)
